result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:23 AM Defendant Justin K Feight not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Justin K Feight.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant may appear by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

8:40 AM Defendant Justin K Feight in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Justin K Feight.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel made statements regarding bail and defendant's employment.  State requests cash bail.  Court grants reduction of cash bail from $10,000 to $1,250.00.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

COURT REDUCES CASH BOND FROM $10,000 TO $1,250.00.
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (including her address)/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Bail/bond hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:37 AM Defendant Justin K Feight in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Justin K Feight.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Thurston in court for the State of Wisconsin. City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Carly Rowson sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Thurston. Attorney Klein does not have any questions for this Officer. Attorney Thurston would ask for a brief recess to allow for the Officer to review a booking photo of the defendant and will recall her as a witness. Attorney Klein objects as the State's witness was unable to identify the defendant. Court takes a short recess at 8:46 AM. Matter recalled at 9:30 AM with the same appearances. The State recalls Officer Rowson. City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Carly Rowson previously sworn in and testifies on direct regarding the identification of the defendant. The Court finds there has been a proper identification of the defendant. State rests. State moves for bind over without argument. Attorney Klein objects to bind over without argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Court notes the defendant filed a request for modification of bail prior to Attorney Klein being appointed. Attorney Klein would ask for time to prepare a formal bail motion. The Court will set this matter for a bail hearing before the Trial Court next week.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
